name: Introduction to Humanities
description: A broad overview of the humanities, including literature, philosophy, art, music, and religion.

name: Classical Culture
description: An introduction to the culture, religion, art and literature of the ancient world, including the Greek and Roman Empires.

name: Introduction to Ancient Greek
description: A foundational course in reading, writing, and speaking Ancient Greek.

name: Introduction to Ancient Latin
description: A foundational course in reading, writing, and speaking Ancient Latin.

name: Ancient Greek and Latin Reading
description: An introduction to the interpretation of Greek and Latin literature from the classical period.

name: Classical Art and Archaeology
description: A survey of the art and artifacts of the ancient world, focusing on the Greek and Roman Empires.

name: Classical Mythology
description: A survey of the gods, goddesses, heroes, and villains of Greek and Roman mythology.

name: Classical Philosophy
description: An introduction to the major philosophical movements of the ancient world, including the Pre-Socratics, Plato, and Aristotle.

name: Classical Literature
description: An introduction to the major works of the ancient world, including Homer, Virgil, and Ovid.
